newsitem.title: UK: UK b/socs net new approvals 3.177 bln stg in May.
newsitem.headline: UK b/socs net new approvals 3.177 bln stg in May.

text.p: The British Building Societies Association (BSA) released the following seasonally adjusted data on lending:
MORTGAGE ADVANCES AND NEW APPROVALS TO LEND (in 1000s)
NOTES - approval = borrower accepts offer of advance; advance = actual loan, on average some 10 wks after commitment; advances tend to reflect new approvals made 2 or 3 mths ago.
BSA director-general Adrian Coles said there was every indication that the housing market was continuing its steady recovery.
"The figures suggest that all measures of activity have improved -- approvals as well as net and gross advances are up on both a seasonally adjusted and unadjusted basis," he said.
But recovery was still patchy, with no indication the housing market was entering boom conditions.
Coles urged the government not to reduce or abolish tax relief on mortgage interest payments in the July 2 budget as this could have a detrimental impact on the housing market.
Building societies performed well in the savings market in May, attracting a net inflow of 878 million stg, he said.
"It is likely that much of this is from former customers of newly converted banks," Coles added.
